content.description: The deal here is just getting use to the SOFT rock...but it goes...just sew it up!
content.protection: Small cams up to a # 1 and some nuts gets you to a bolt anchor with webbing.
content.location: Right a ways from Heart of Sandstone and on the same side of the canyon near the mouth of a very constricted part of the slot. A right angling crack on a slabby face.

climbs.name: Second Thoughts
climbs.fa: Zac Warren, Drake"P.H." Kroger and Roy Suggett

content.description: Simple aid on runners past two bolts gets you to the crack.  The crux is dealing with 120 ft. of continuous 4 in. crack.
content.protection: Shoulder length runners, a few smaller cams and all the 3s and 4s you can bring.  Three bolts and slings at the top. Use TWO Ropes!  Bring lots of tape!
content.location: North or left side of the slot as you go up stream on an obvious line just up off the floor of the canyon.

climbs.name: Heart of Sandstone
climbs.fa: Zac Warren, Roy Suggett, and Phyllis Suggett

content.description: Just past the last of three bolts, the crux is getting into the main crack on the face to the right.  Then hang on for a LONG ride!
content.protection: Bring every cam you can beg, borrow, or steal - .5s to a couple of 4s. Clip the first bolt with a quick draw, the second with a shoulder length runner, and the third with a long runner. This keeps the rope in a straighter line and also out of the short crack right and between bolts 2 and 3(see beta topo). Gear most likely is not needed between bolt 2 and 3.  If you think you do, then you might want to back off right then and there!  Bolt anchor with webbing. TWO Ropes!
content.location: Just right of Second Thoughts and right of an offwidth you start in but move right and out of quickly to the obvious line on the right of an attached pillar on the face.
